0.title: IPL auction is important, 50% of the job is done on auction table: Gambhir
0.article_body: Stressing on the importance of IPL mega auction, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said, "50% of the job is done on the auction table. It helps the management when you pick a good side." He added, "But as long as they don't perform on...field, it doesn't matter even if you pick the best possible players." It's LSG's maiden IPL season.

1.title: Over 50 bonded labourers rescued from a brick kiln in UP's Bhadohi
1.article_body: In a joint raid conducted by the district administration, labour department and the police department, 55 bonded labourers including children were rescued from a brick kiln in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. Labour Enforcement Officer Pratima Maurya said that all the rescued workers hailed from Chhattisgarh. The brick kiln owners Jameel Khan and Hayat Khan fled from the spot, Maurya added.

2.title: Fake reports: Indian High Commission on rumours of SL politicians escaping to India
2.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka has denied reports that some Sri Lankan politicians have escaped to India amid the economic crisis in the country. "High Commission has recently noticed rumours circulating...that certain political persons and their families have fled to India. These are fake and blatantly false reports, devoid of any truth or substance," it tweeted.

3.title: Once I started to understand game bit more, was always fan of Kohli: Gill
3.article_body: On being asked about his greatest inspiration, GT opener Shubman Gill said while growing up, it was Sachin Tendulkar. "Once he retired and once I started to understand the game a bit more, I was always a fan of Virat [Kohli] bhai," he added. With 384 runs from 12 matches, Gill is currently the leading-scorer for GT in ongoing IPL.

4.title: India assisting other nations in fight against COVID-19: JP Nadda
4.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said that India is assisting other nations in the fight against COVID-19 under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Crediting PM's leadership for the COVID-19 vaccines, he said, "We've given 18.5 crore vaccine doses to 100 countries." The Opposition is forced to seek votes based on development because of PM Modi, he added.

5.title: Father shoots son dead after a scuffle in UP's Kaushambi
5.article_body: Police said that a man shot at his son with his licensed gun after a scuffle in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, adding that the youth died during treatment. Reports say that the accused, Shiv Narayan, a farmer, lived with his sons Rakesh Singh and Brajesh Singh. The victim, Brajesh, received injuries to the chest and neck and collapsed, the police added.

6.title: Second hate speech case registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George
6.article_body: A new hate speech case has been registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George, a few days after he was arrested and released for making communal remarks. Kochi City Police Commissioner Nagaraju Chakilam said George has violated the bail conditions by making the same mistake again. He was earlier arrested on May 1 for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims.

7.title: GIC, Tiger Global among 64 anchor investors for Delhivery IPO: Report
7.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's IPO, which opened for the anchor investors on Tuesday, attracted as many as 64 investors, Moneycontrol reported. These include GIC, Tiger Global Investments and Goldman Sachs Funds among others. ICICI Prudential Flexicap Fund, HDFC large and mid-cap fund and entities from SBI were reportedly also part of the list.

8.title: Female anti-Romeo squad constable raped by fellow policeman in UP
8.article_body: A female constable of the anti-Romeo squad was abused and raped by a fellow policeman in Uttar Pradesh on the pretext of marriage. The accused surrendered 70 days after the woman complained and has been sent to judicial custody. The victim had written to the Superintendent of Police complaining about the same, after which a formal case was registered.

9.title: GT beat LSG to record their biggest win, become 1st team to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs
9.article_body: GT defeated LSG by 62 runs to record their biggest win (by runs) in IPL 2022. With the win, GT moved to the top of the points table and became the first team to qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. Shubman Gill top-scored for GT with 63*(49), while their vice-captain Rashid Khan recorded bowling figures of 3.5-0-24-4.

10.title: Man City confirm agreement to sign Haaland in deal reported to be worth £51.5 million
10.article_body: Manchester City have confirmed a deal to sign Erling Haaland from Borussia Dortmund this summer. The striker's buyout clause, reported to be £51.5 million, has been met by Manchester City. The Norway international will earn £375,000 per week excluding bonuses. Haaland will join the club on July 1, subject to the club finalising terms with the player.

11.title: Govt calls out Twitter for violating India's free speech laws: Bloomberg report
11.article_body: The government has called out Twitter for violating the Indian Constitution and free speech rights, Bloomberg reported. The Ministry of Information Technology objected to the suspension of lawyer Sanjay Hegde's Twitter account about three years ago in a court filing last week, it further added. It had earlier said the matter was for Twitter and Hegde to resolve.

12.title: DC captain Pant is almost at his best when he's reckless: Vettori
12.article_body: Discussing Rishabh Pant's form in ongoing IPL, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said the DC captain is almost at his best when he's "reckless". He added, "We've seen him play some exceptional innings when he just continues to take teams downtime and time again." Pant has scored 281 runs from 11 matches so far. DC are currently fifth in standings.

13.title: $800 billion wiped off crypto market's value in a month
13.article_body: Crypto assets lost $800 billion in market value over the past month, touching a low of $1.4 trillion on Tuesday, as per data site CoinMarketCap. This comes as world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin briefly hit a 10-month low on Tuesday before rebounding to $31,450. Meanwhile, stablecoin TerraUSD lost a third of its value as it lost its peg to the dollar.

14.title: Pfizer to buy Biohaven for $11.6 bn in its biggest deal since 2016
14.article_body: Pfizer will acquire biotech group Biohaven Pharmaceuticals for $11.6 billion, marking its biggest deal since 2016. Biohaven's Rimegepant medication, used as both a treatment and preventative for migraines, is expected to bring in sales of over $4 billion by 2030. This comes as Pfizer expects sales of its COVID-19 vaccines to drop from last year's highs.

15.title: India's outward FDI drops nearly 50% y-o-y to $3.39 bn in April
15.article_body: India's outward foreign direct investment (OFDI) nearly halved to $3.39 billion in April on an annual basis, data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. In comparison, the OFDI stood at $6.71 billion in April 2021 and $3.44 billion in March 2022. The equity component in April was $544.87 million and loans amounted to $764.25 million.

16.title: Netflix may begin crackdown on password-sharing by end of 2022: Report
16.article_body: Netflix could launch lower-priced ad-supported plans in the final three months of 2022 and begin cracking down on password-sharing during the same time, the NYT reported. It said the details were mentioned in a note to Netflix employees by the company's executives. Notably, Netflix lost subscribers for the first time in over 10 years in the first quarter of 2022.

17.title: I'd like to meet him: Musk as Twitter user shares pic of his 'Chinese lookalike'
17.article_body: After a Twitter user shared a picture of Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk's Chinese lookalike, Musk said, "I'd like to meet this guy." Musk, however, said he wasn't sure if the man was real, adding, "(It's) hard to tell with deepfakes these days." "Should we deploy Chinese Elon Musk as a decoy?" the user had asked.

18.title: Not about North or South, it's about coming up with good entertainers: Jackky
18.article_body: Actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani has said, "It's not about North or South, it's about coming up with good quality entertainers." He added, "All kinds of audiences enjoying one particular film is actually great. [The] common audience is telling us something and we must listen." This comes after films like 'RRR', 'KGF' franchise and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercially successful across India.

19.title: Cocaine worth $14 million found near diver's body in Australia
19.article_body: Australian police on Tuesday launched a probe after 50 kg of cocaine (worth $14 million) was found near the body of a diver at a riverbank in New South Wales state. The deceased, whose identity is yet to be ascertained, was found by authorities in an unconscious state on Monday. Investigators have searched an overseas-registered ship docked near crime scene.

20.title: 44 members of right-wing groups detained over protest to rename Qutub Minar
20.article_body: As many as 44 members of right-wing organisations, who recited Hanuman Chalisa outside Delhi's Qutub Minar and demanded the minaret be renamed 'Vishnu Stambh', were detained on Tuesday, DCP South said. The demonstrators alleged Qutub Minar was built by "great king Vikramaditya", but Qutubuddin Aibak later claimed credit for it. "Permission was not granted for the gathering," the DCP added.

21.title: CM Gehlot was celebrating birthday during Jodhpur violence: Nadda
21.article_body: BJP national president JP Nadda on Tuesday said that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot was busy celebrating his birthday when there was violence in Jodhpur. "Every time we open a newspaper, we see a new incident happening in Rajasthan," he said. The state is on top for atrocities against women, Dalits and the state's leaders are involved in corruption, he added.

22.title: Don't test our patience: MNS chief to Maha CM on loudspeaker issue
22.article_body: Amid the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra, MNS chief Raj Thackeray in his letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray told the state government to 'not test the party's patience'. In his letter, Raj Thackeray said that over 28,000 MNS workers were served notices. He also questioned why many MNS workers were arrested even before they began protesting against loudspeakers in mosques.

23.title: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee to inaugurate party headquarters in Guwahati
23.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Abhishek Banerjee will visit Guwahati on Wednesday to inaugurate a new state headquarters and meet the TMC's state leadership. The announcement comes weeks after ex-Congress leader Ripun Bora joined TMC as head of party's Assam unit. "We're planning to fight the panchayat polls in Assam and field candidates in...Lok Sabha elections," a TMC leader said.

24.title: Akhilesh Yadav & his uncle Shivpal meet at wedding in UP, don't talk
24.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav came across his uncle Shivpal Yadav at a wedding in Lucknow but the two leaders didn't talk to each other. They were present at the wedding of the nephew of former Uttar Pradesh DGP Jagmohan Yadav. Akhilesh had last month said that Shivpal Yadav, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, has a soft spot for BJP.

25.title: Set your priorities right: Congress to Punjab CM after Mohali blast
25.article_body: Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja on Tuesday asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to set his priorities right and focus on serious challenges confronting the state. The "audacious terror attack" at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali was an attempt at exploiting the inexperience of the current government, he said. Mann had earlier said that a probe was underway.

26.title: Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye: Naqvi on Shaheen Bagh
26.article_body: Amid a row over the demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Tuesday said, "Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye". He added that it has become a fashion to give a "communal colour" to criminal acts, and asserted that "legal action" against "illegal acts" should be supported.

27.title: E-scooter fires are very rare, but they may occur in the future: Ola Electric CEO
27.article_body: Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said at a private company event that incidents of electric scooters catching fire are "very rare and isolated", as per Reuters. However, he noted that there might be such occurrences in the future. Aggarwal said, "There'll be, sometimes, some minor defects in, maybe the cell, maybe something else, which will cause some internal short circuit."

28.title: Man attacks wife with an axe during a domestic dispute in Lucknow
28.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman is critical after she was attacked with an axe by her husband during a domestic dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. They said that the victim, Laxmi Devi, suffered injuries on her neck, hand and waist. The accused fled the spot after the incident and efforts are on to arrest him, police added.

29.title: Apple discontinues iPod after 20 years
29.article_body: Apple on Tuesday announced that it is discontinuing the iPod touch, its last remaining music player model in the market. "iPod touch will be available while supplies last," the company said in a blog. Apple had introduced the first iPod on October 23, 2001, which had the capacity to store 1,000 songs in MP3 format and a 10-hour battery life.

30.title: Release date of 'Ek Villain 2' postponed, will now release on July 29
30.article_body: The release date of Arjun Kapoor-starrer 'Ek Villain Returns' has been postponed. Taking to Instagram, the film's director Mohit Suri wrote, "'Ek Villain Returns' gets a new release date, 29th July 2022." The film was initially slated to release on July 8. The film also stars Tara Sutaria, John Abraham, and Disha Patani.

31.title: BJP paying lip-service to people displaced from PoJK: Ex-minister
31.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Minister Ajay Kumar Sadhotra on Monday accused the BJP of delivering "lip service" to people displaced from the Pakistan-occupied J&K (PoJK). "BJP is raising false slogans besides rhetoric on every crucial issue. The way the PoJK-displaced people have been treated speaks volumes about its insensitivity towards their plight," he said.

32.title: Russia to skip UNHRC's session on Ukraine, calls it 'new political show'
32.article_body: Russia has said that it will not participate in UNHRC's special session on the Ukraine crisis, describing the upcoming event as a 'new political show'. Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokesperson Maria Zakharova further said that Moscow's explanations of its ongoing military offensive in Ukraine will be ignored "yet again". Russia was suspended from the UNHRC on April 7.

33.title: Why only Assam?: Yechury asks Shah to remove AFSPA from other states
33.article_body: CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to withdraw the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) from other Northeastern states. "Why do not you withdraw AFSPA from everywhere? Is there a political motive behind this? There will be some conspiracy to provoke communal polarisation again," he said

34.title: Never dreamt I'd come this far: Dhanush on 20 yrs in film industry
34.article_body: After completing 20 years in the film industry, actor Dhanush took to Twitter and wrote, "Time flies, never did I even dream I'd come this far when I started 'Thulluvadho Ilamai'." "I can't thank my fans enough for the continuous love...support, you are the pillars of my strength," he added. Dhanush will next be seen in 'The Gray Man'.

35.title: Spain dismisses spy chief over scandal involving Pegasus spyware
35.article_body: Spanish spy chief Paz Esteban has been dismissed over a dual phone-hacking scandal involving Pegasus spyware, Defence Minister Margarita Robles said. "Of course there are security flaws and there will continue to be," Robles said. Spain's National Intelligence Centre is also being questioned over its failure to prevent PM Pedro Sanchez and other officials' phones from being hacked using Pegasus.

36.title: IMD issues red alert for Andhra Pradesh as Cyclone Asani changes track
36.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red warning for Andhra Pradesh, as severe cyclonic storm Asani has changed its track. According to the IMD, Cyclone Asani is likely to touch the coastal belt in Andhra Pradesh between Visakhapatnam and Kakinada on Wednesday morning. The cyclone is likely to further weaken into a depression on Thursday morning.

37.title: Kejriwal thought himself above law, court proved him wrong: Bagga
37.article_body: After Punjab and Haryana High Court put a stay on his arrest till July 5, BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal thought he was above law, but the court proved him wrong." He further alleged that Punjab Police are tracking those who are tweeting or speaking against Kejriwal instead of focussing on their real duty.

38.title: India looking at tapping new markets for edible oil: Sitharaman
38.article_body: India is looking at tapping new markets for the import of edible oils, following the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "There are various hurdles in terms of importing oils. You know we are not able to import edible oil; we were getting sunflower oil. Now, we are not," she said.

39.title: Axis Bank awaits probe report on alleged mutual fund scam: Report
39.article_body: Axis Bank will wait for the report on an investigation into alleged front-running at Axis Mutual Fund (MF) before taking the final decision on penalising guilty officials, Moneycontrol reported. The allegations are being probed by two external agencies appointed by Axis MF. The probe was launched in February 2022, Axis MF MD and CEO Chandresh Nigam said on May 8.

40.title: 40 places raided as CBI probes NGOs over FCRA licence, MHA officials questioned
40.article_body: The CBI raided 40 locations in a nationwide crackdown on NGOs in connection to alleged Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) violations, reports said on Tuesday. The agency is investigating alleged collusion between government officials and NGO representatives for illegal FCRA licence clearances in exchange for bribes. Six Ministry of Home Affairs officials are reportedly being questioned.

41.title: Historic Pak bridge swept away by glacial lake's water amid heatwave
41.article_body: Pakistan's historic Hassanabad bridge was swept away by a glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) amid a persistent heatwave. Videos that surfaced on social media showed water slamming against the concrete of the bridge, leading to the collapse of the bridge. The Shishper glacier reportedly started melting due to the heatwave that led to the floods over the weekend.

42.title: BYJU'S buys Northwest Executive Education for $100 mn: Report
42.article_body: BYJU'S group company Great Learning has reportedly acquired Singapore's executive education firm Northwest Executive Education in a stock and cash deal of around $100 million. "BYJU'S is aggressively focusing on the higher education segment...Northwest Executive's acquisition will just add to it," a source told Moneycontrol. In February, Great Learning had bought out recruitment platform Superset.

43.title: 9-yr-old girl raped & murdered by a relative in MP, man arrested
43.article_body: Police said that a nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by a distant relative, during a marriage function in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district. They said that the 24-year-old accused was arrested in the case. During interrogation, the accused confessed to the crime and said that he killed the victim to hide the crime, the police added.

44.title: LSG are peaking at the right time in IPL: Jaffer
44.article_body: Talking about table-toppers LSG, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said KL Rahul-led side are peaking at the right time in IPL 2022. He added that they won their last match against KKR with a big margin of 75 runs and every match of theirs has gone down the wire. "They've never lost any matches as a one-sided affair," he further said.

45.title: Equity investors' wealth falls over ₹11.22 lakh crore in 3 days
45.article_body: Equity investors have become poorer by over ₹11.22 lakh crore in three days following a sell-off in markets amid weak global cues. Sensex fell for the third consecutive session on Tuesday, falling 1,337.38 points or 2.4% since Friday. Foreign institutional investors remained net-sellers on Monday, offloading shares worth a net ₹3,361.80 crore.

46.title: Fight for your rights like Jignesh Mevani: Rahul to tribals in Gujarat
46.article_body: Addressing tribals in Gujarat's Dahod on Tuesday, Congress' Rahul Gandhi urged people to seek inspiration from Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani for his "fearless fight" against BJP. Gandhi launched 'Adivasi Adhikar Satyagraha' campaign today ahead of state's Assembly polls. Jignesh Mevani has been sentenced to three months in jail by Gujarat court for holding an 'Azadi' march in 2017 without permission.

47.title: MP man who helped people during COVID-19 booked for raping 27-yr-old
47.article_body: A 34-year-old man who helped people during the second wave of COVID-19 was booked for allegedly raping his 27-year-old tenant in Bhopal, police said on Tuesday. The woman in her complaint said that Javed Khan first raped her on March 3 while her husband was at work. He continued the act till April 25 after which the family shifted.

48.title: Chris Hemsworth is godly, he's also kind & good actor: Elizabeth Olsen
48.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen called Chris Hemsworth "godly" and added, "His arm is way bigger than my head...he's also a charming, kind and good actor." Elizabeth and her 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' co-star Benedict Cumberbatch were asked to agree or disagree if Hemsworth was the most handsome actor in the MCU, to which they both agreed.

49.title: Goal is to win one of the 3 Grand Slams that remain this year: Alcaraz
49.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said winning one of the remaining three Grand Slams of 2022 is his goal this year, adding he's hopeful to do it at upcoming French Open. "It's a great motivation for me [to win a Slam] and I'll fight for it," he added. The 19-year-old recently won his fourth title of 2022 at Madrid Open.

50.title: It's always special: Djokovic on his matches vs Nadal at Italian Open
50.article_body:
World number one Novak Djokovic said his matches against 10-time champion Rafael Nadal at Italian Open have always been special. "We've played so many years...so many matchups on this surface than any other surface," he added. Nadal and Djokovic are slated to meet in semi-finals. 
Djokovic has won only three of his nine matches against Nadal in Rome.

51.title: 25-yr-old woman patient raped by sweeper in UP hospital
51.article_body: A 25-year-old woman patient was allegedly raped by a sweeper on May 7 in UP’s Mirzapur divisional hospital when she had gone to the washroom. The woman informed her husband about the incident, following which the matter was reported to the police on Tuesday. Mirzapur ASP Sanjay Kumar said that three teams have been formed to arrest the accused.

52.title: US removes 'Taiwan is part of China' reference from State Dept site, China reacts
52.article_body: US State Department website's section on Taiwan has removed reference to Taiwan being part of China. The updated text calls Taiwan "a leading democracy". Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said there's only one China, Taiwan belongs to China, and People's Republic of China is the sole legal government representing the whole country, further calling US' move "a petty act".

53.title: Centre ruined country's economy: Congress leader Sachin Pilot
53.article_body: After the Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the Centre has ruined the country's economy. Pilot said, "The tenure of...Centre on the economic issues of...[India] is full of failures." Pilot said the BJP has put the country in economic crisis with inflation, unemployment and economic mismanagement.

54.title: Saddening to see no relief provided to post-poll victims: WB Guv
54.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that it's saddening that those who lost their properties after the post-poll violence in the state last year still haven't received compensation. "The memorandum demands financial compensation for all families whose properties got destructed. I will study this memorandum as administration should be unbiased," he added.

55.title: '83' made around ₹200 cr amid 3rd wave, which isn't bad: Ranveer Singh
55.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh revealed that his film '83' was criticised by the trade for not making as much money as it was projected to make. However, he added, "The film still made around ₹200 crore in the middle of the third wave which is not bad at all." "It was just a case of unfortunate timing," he added.

56.title: I stood up for Aishwarya when media fat-shamed her: Raveena
56.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has recalled standing up for Aishwarya Rai saying she just had a baby when the media fat-shamed her. Raveena added, "A journalist said, 'Arrey Raveena ji, you have become so fat. You used to be 'mast cheez' and are now doing reality shows.' I told him, 'My fat will go away but how will your face change?'"

57.title: Bihar college principal, lecturers among 4 arrested for BPSC paper leak
57.article_body: Four people have been arrested in connection with the leak of the Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations. The arrested persons include a principal of the college where the leak occurred, two lecturers and Barhara BDO Jai Vardhan Gupta. BPSC had cancelled the exam after the paper was leaked right before the exam on Sunday.

58.title: Andhra CM's cousin arrested in extortion case, CM says 'no one will be spared'
58.article_body: YSRCP leader and cousin of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, YS Konda Reddy, was arrested on Tuesday in an alleged extortion case. The accused had allegedly demanded bribe from a construction company's owners for allowing them to continue their project in Chakrayapet Mandal. CM Reddy, while ordering a probe into the case, said no one will be spared.

59.title: Swiggy suspends Supr Daily operations in 5 cities including Delhi, Mumbai
59.article_body: Swiggy is suspending its subscription-based fresh groceries service Supr Daily's operations in five cities, namely Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad and Chennai. Swiggy will continue to serve its users in Bengaluru and "double down" on its efforts there. "We, unfortunately, are yet to demonstrate a clear path to profitability," Supr Daily CEO Phani Kishan Addepalli's e-mail to employees read.

60.title: 'Yellow brick road' found at the bottom of Pacific Ocean, footage released
60.article_body: A team of researchers discovered what looked like a yellow brick road at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean last month. Footage from the expedition showed the path which appeared to be paved with cobblestones and the researchers are heard describing it as "bizarre". One of the researchers is heard calling it "the road to Atlantis".

61.title: Never too old: Omar after ex-H'yana CM Chautala passes Class 10 &12 at 87
61.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and NC leader Omar Abdullah on Tuesday praised former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala after the latter passed Class 10 and 12 at the age of 87 on Tuesday. "A person is never too old to learn. Congratulations Chautala (sahib)," Abdullah tweeted. Haryana Education Board officials handed over the marksheets to Chautala in Chandigarh today.

62.title: Dismiss Jairam Thakur govt over HP's deteriorating law & order: AAP to Guv
62.article_body: AAP on Tuesday asked Himachal Pradesh Governor RV Arlekar to dismiss the Jairam Thakur-led government over "deteriorating" law and order in Himachal Pradesh. Earlier, AAP held a demonstration outside the Shimla Deputy Commissioner's office for the same reason. This comes after Khalistani flags were tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly.

63.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Assam govt's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta'
63.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the Assam government's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta' in Guwahati on Tuesday. "The newsletter will enable citizens to stay connected with the government and its policies," its editor Bishnu Kamal Bora said. It will be printed in Assamese, English, and Hindi initially and in Bengali and other regional languages of Assam later on, he added.

64.title: Karnataka IPS officer Ravindranath resigns for 4th time, cites 'harassment'
64.article_body: IPS officer P Ravindranath on Tuesday submitted his resignation from the police force for the fourth time in his career, citing "harassment". "I'm prematurely transferred without any public interest...since I've taken legal action against people involved in the fake caste certificate issue," he said in a letter. "I'm pained to observe the apathy shown by state Chief Secretary," Ravindranath added.

65.title: Checkpoints set up to stop Rajapaksa supporters from fleeing Sri Lanka
65.article_body: Anti-government protesters in Colombo have set up checkpoints on a road leading to city's airport in a bid to prevent supporters of ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa from leaving Sri Lanka amid the ongoing economic crisis. The move comes a day after violent clashes erupted between pro and anti-government protesters, claiming at least eight lives. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as PM on Monday.

66.title: Had tanks around us in Afghanistan during Khuda Gawah shoot: Producer
66.article_body: Producer Manoj Desai recalled filming Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Khuda Gawah' in Afghanistan. Manoj said the then-president Mohammad Najibullah aired only old films of Amitabh and Sridevi on television. "Najibullah...was so honoured to have these stars...Whenever [we went there] to shoot, we had 4-5 tanks in front and 4-5 tanks behind us," he stated, adding they had a unit of 200 people.

67.title: CBI raids 8 places in Jammu, Srinagar, Mumbai in J&K Bank scam case
67.article_body: The CBI on Tuesday searched eight locations in Jammu, Srinagar and Mumbai in connection with alleged irregularities in purchase of a building by J&K Bank in Mumbai in 2010, officials said. They added that this included searching the premises of then J&K Bank Chairman Haseeb Drabu. In April, the ED questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in the same case.

68.title: Delhi sees 1,118 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate at 4.38%
68.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 1,118 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 799 cases recorded on Monday. One person died due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 4.38% as compared to 4.94% reported on Monday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the national capital rose to 5,471 from 5,369 reported on Monday.

69.title: I gave up acting at one point: Mrunal Thakur on 10 years of acting
69.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, speaking about 10 years of her acting career, stated that at one point she felt like it was not working out and gave up acting. She added that she travelled to Indonesia and lived there for six months. "('Love Sonia') broke the stereotype [of my television actress image]...'Love Sonia' was my ticket to Bollywood," the actress said.

70.title: 9 pilots, 32 cabin staff failed pre-flight alcohol tests in last 4 months: DGCA
70.article_body: A total of nine pilots and 32 cabin crew members failed the pre-flight alcohol tests this year, DGCA said on Tuesday. Of these, two pilots and two cabin crew members were suspended for three years after being found positive during the breath analyser test for the second time, it added. The remaining 37 people were suspended for three months.

71.title: Their misfortune: Javed Ali on Lata not being mentioned at Oscars, Grammys
71.article_body: Singer Javed Ali has commented on late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar not being paid a tribute at the 2022 Oscars and Grammys, saying that it is their misfortune. "If they would have given it to her the award would have become much bigger. She was an award in herself," Javed added. Lata passed away on February 6 after battling COVID-19.

72.title: Sri Lanka issues shoot-on-sight orders amid riots
72.article_body: Amid an economic crisis in the country, the Sri Lankan Defence Ministry ordered its Armed Forces to open fire at anyone looting public property or causing harm to others. This comes after a day of clashes left several people dead and injured more than 200. Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa had resigned amid the economic crisis.

73.title: Sri Lankan Prez urges for peace as death toll due to clashes rises to 8
73.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Tuesday urged people to "stop violence and acts of revenge" against citizens as death toll due to recent clashes rose to eight. He added that efforts will be made to restore political stability amid economic crisis. Nearly 250 people were injured after clashes between pro and anti-government protesters broke out in Colombo on Monday.

74.title: GT will be 1st team to qualify for playoffs in IPL 2022: Harbhajan
74.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said that GT are going to beat LSG and become the first team to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. "Hardik Pandya-led side is very strong. Rashid Khan is in great form...coach Ashish Nehra is giving them just the right amount of confidence," he stated. Both teams have eight wins each so far.

75.title: Ex-Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu, others booked by CID over 'corrupt activities'
75.article_body: The CID has booked former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and other private individuals and firms over irregularities in the construction of an internal ring road in Amaravati. The complainant in the case, YSR Congress Party MLA ARK Reddy, has alleged certain "illegal and corrupt activities" were committed by government officials between 2014 and 2019 in connection with construction.

76.title: Anonymous donor clears $300,000 debt of over 100 US college students
76.article_body: An anonymous donor has cleared the debt of over 100 students of Wiley College in US' Texas, college authorities said. The announcement that the debt worth $300,000 (around ₹2.31 crore) was cleared, was made during their convocation. A clip shared by the college showed the students cheering after being told that they were debt-free and didn't owe the college anything.

77.title: 31-yr-old ex-NBA player Adreian Payne shot dead, police release pic of suspect
77.article_body: Ex-NBA player Adreian Payne was shot dead in a Florida townhouse on Monday. Police were called to the scene of the shooting in Orlando at around 1.30 am, following which the 31-year-old was rushed to the hospital, where he was declared dead. Police have released the picture of a suspect, 29-year-old Lawrence Dority, who was arrested and charged with murder.

78.title: Punjab govt not serious about border security: Union Minister
78.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat criticised the AAP government in Punjab over the blast in Mohali, saying that the state government is "not serious about border security". Terming the blast as "unfortunate", Shekhawat said, "Punjab is a border area with sensitive boundaries." There is a need for more vigilance and the state government needs to make serious efforts, he added.

79.title: Nepal bowler Sita Rana Magar does viral 'Pushpa' celebration after taking wicket
79.article_body: Nepal's bowler Sita Rana Magar moved her hand under the chin, mimicking actor Allu Arjun's style in the movie 'Pushpa', to celebrate after taking a wicket. She did the viral 'Pushpa' celebration in a match between Tornadoes Women and Sapphires Women at the Fairbreak Invitational Women's T20 2022 tournament in Dubai. ICC's official Instagram account shared Magar's 'Pushpa' celebration video.

80.title: SP MLA Azam Khan gets interim bail in land grab case, another case pending
80.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Tuesday granted interim bail to Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan in a land grabbing case. However, he will continue to stay in jail for another pending case. There are a total of 88 cases registered against Khan and he has been granted bail in 87 of these cases.

81.title: Zomato's market cap falls below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion
81.article_body: Zomato's market capitalisation fell below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion on Tuesday after the food delivery platform's shares hit a new all-time low. Zomato's shares fell 7.22% on Tuesday to end at ₹52.65 on the NSE, giving it a market capitalisation of about $5.3 billion. Notably, Zomato's rival Swiggy was valued at $10.7 billion earlier this year.

82.title: Canara Bank detects frauds worth ₹3.9 cr in internal probe: Report
82.article_body: State-led Canara Bank is investigating fraud in its housing finance unit Can Fin Homes after a whistleblower alleged irregularities in certain accounts, Reuters reported quoting a source. The bank has detected frauds in 37 accounts worth ₹3.9 crore, the source said. They added that fake income tax return documents had been submitted for these accounts.

83.title: Malaysia may cut palm oil export tax by half: Report
83.article_body: The Commodities Ministry of the world's second-largest palm oil producer Malaysia has proposed to cut the export tax on the oil by half amid a global edible oil shortage. Malaysia's Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Zuraida Kamaruddin told Reuters that the country could temporarily cut the tax from 8% to 4%-6%. Recently, top global producer Indonesia banned palm oil exports.

84.title: Chinese Prez Xi Jinping suffering from cerebral aneurysm, was hospitalised: Reports
84.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping is suffering from cerebral aneurysm and had to be hospitalised at the end of 2021, reports said. He reportedly preferred to be treated with traditional Chinese medicines rather than going for surgery. There have been speculations about Xi's health as he had avoided meeting foreign leaders since COVID-19 outbreak till the Beijing Winter Olympics.

85.title: Thanks Ridhi Dogra for the idea of a jail: Ekta Kapoor on 'Lock Upp'
85.article_body: 'Lock Upp' producer Ekta Kapoor took to Instagram and wrote, "Thanks Ridhi for the idea of a jail when I wanted to be different in the reality space!" She further thanked the show's host Kangana Ranaut and wrote, "Thank you, Kangana for supporting an Indian concept...and doing a fantastic job!" Comedian Munawar Faruqui won the first season.

86.title: 5 Indian startups among 100 joining WEF's Tech Pioneers 2022
86.article_body: Five Indian startups are among the 100 startups that have joined World Economic Forum's Technology Pioneers 2022. These include Vahan, which is building a full-stack labour marketplace for blue-collar workers and SmartCoin Financials, a tech-driven financial inclusion platform. The other three are waste commerce firm Recykal, plant protein startup Proeon and freight management platform Pandocorp.

87.title: India enter 2022 Uber Cup knockouts after 4-1 win over USA
87.article_body: India entered the knockout stage of 2022 Uber Cup Finals after defeating USA 4-1 in their Group D tie in Bangkok on Tuesday. While world number seven PV Sindhu, Aakarshi Kashyap, Ashmita Chaliha and doubles duo of Tanisha Crasto and Treesa Jolly won their respective matches, the doubles pair of Ritika Thaker and Simran Singhi lost their match.

88.title: Questioned in theft case, woman kills self in Kanpur shelter home
88.article_body: A 32-year-old woman from Unnao allegedly died by suicide in a shelter home in Kanpur after the police questioned her and her minor daughter in a theft case. After the death, her relatives reached the mortuary and staged a protest. "We are planning to conduct an inquiry to get all the facts in the case," Kanpur DCP BBGTS Murthy said.

89.title: Maharashtra announces state funeral for Pandit Shivkumar Sharma
89.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a state funeral for santoor maestro Padma Vibhushan Pandit Shivkumar Sharma who passed away after a cardiac failure on Tuesday. His funeral will be held at the Vile Parle Hindu cremation ground near the Juhu airport in Mumbai on Wednesday. The mortal remains will be kept at his home from 10 am to 1 pm.

90.title: GT to bat first against LSG in top-of-the-table clash, make 3 changes to playing XI
90.article_body: Second-placed GT captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against first-placed LSG. GT have made three changes to their playing XI, with Matthew Wade, Sai Kishore and Yash Dayal replacing Lockie Ferguson, Sai Sudharsan and Pradeep Sangwan. Karan Sharma has replaced Ravi Bishnoi in LSG's playing XI.

91.title: Tesla recalls 1.3 lakh vehicles in US over display malfunction
91.article_body: Tesla is recalling about 1.3 lakh vehicles in the US following an overheating issue that may cause the center touchscreen display to malfunction, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said. The recall includes Tesla's 2021-2022 models S and X and its 3 and Y models from 2022. No crashes or injuries have been reported due to the issue, Tesla said.

92.title: 3 killed, 20 injured after mini-truck falls off culvert in MP
92.article_body: At least three people were killed and 20 others were injured after a mini-truck fell off a culvert in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. Police said the victims were going to attend a wedding in Chandra Shekhar Azad Nagar. The injured were admitted to the district hospital for treatment, officials said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed grief over the incident.

93.title: Civilian dead, 2 injured in firing by terrorists trying to escape in J&K
93.article_body: A civilian was killed and two others, including a soldier, sustained injuries after two terrorists allegedly fired at them in a bid to escape after they were intercepted near Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, an Army spokesperson said. The injured persons were airlifted to a hospital in Srinagar. The conditions of the soldier and another civilian are said to be stable.

94.title: Food delivery workers in Dubai go on strike to protest against less pay
94.article_body: Food delivery workers contracted by Talabat in Dubai staged a mass walk-out on Monday to protest against meager pay and inadequate protections at work. The strike comes days after foreign contract workers associated with another food delivery company compelled them to suspend plans to deduct employees' earnings amid surging fuel prices. Notably, strikes and labour unions are illegal in UAE.

95.title: Layout of 'world's first Bitcoin City' in El Salvador unveiled, President shares pics
95.article_body: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has shared the layout of the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that will initially be funded by Bitcoin-backed bonds. Bukele shared on Twitter pictures of a gold-coloured 3D model and rendered images of the city. 'Bitcoin City' will be constructed at the foot of a volcano which is being used to mine Bitcoin using geothermal energy.

96.title: Ex-Andhra Pradesh minister P Narayana arrested in Class 10 paper leak case
96.article_body: Narayana Group of Educational Institutions Founder and former Andhra Pradesh minister P Narayana was arrested by CID officials on Tuesday in connection with a Class 10 exam paper leak case. Nine persons, including government school employees, have been arrested in the case. CID officials arrested Narayana from his residence at Kondapur in Hyderabad.

97.title: Home delivery of liquor may soon be a reality in Delhi
97.article_body: The Delhi excise department has proposed that the Delhi government legalise the home delivery of liquor and stop regulating discounts offered by vendors in the Delhi Excise Policy 2022-23, according to officials. According to the 2021 rules, shops with an L-13 licence may deliver liquor to private homes, but only if the order is received through a mobile app.

98.title: What is Rocket-Propelled Grenade, weapon reportedly used in Mohali blast?
98.article_body: A Rocket-Propelled Grenade (RPG) was reportedly used in Monday's blast at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. The RPG is a portable, shoulder-fired weapon of Soviet origin and experts believe an RPG PG-22 Netto version was used in Mohali. RPG PG-22 Netto has a front-loading tube from which it is fired and has a range of up to 250 meters.

99.title: Russians accidentally kill own troops with flamethrowers, Ukraine thanks them
99.article_body: Russian soldiers on Sunday targeted their own troops with flamethrowers in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhya, killing many of them, Ukraine's military said. Thanking the Russians for the friendly fire incident, Ukraine's 97th Infantry Battalion expressed "satisfaction with actions of the Russian occupiers". "Such actions are positively perceived, supported in every way by the Ukrainian military," it added.

100.title: I also whistled watching Yash's intro scene in 'KGF 2': Sanjay Dutt
100.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt revealed he also whistled during Yash's introduction scene in 'KGF: Chapter 2'. Speaking about the importance of such introduction scenes, he said, "It's a very important part of cinema. I mean, part of cinema where we guys have grown up." "We used to see Amitabh Bachchan in Sholay or in Zanjeer, it was a high," he added.

101.title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes class 10 & 12 at 87, pic surfaces
101.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala on Tuesday passed Class 10 and 12 at the age of 87. Haryana Education Board officials handed over the marksheets to him in Chandigarh today. Chautala had enrolled in Class 12, however, his result was withheld because he had not yet passed Class 10 English exam.

102.title: Army chief Gen Manoj Pande receives Param Vishisht Seva Medal from Prez
102.article_body: Newly-appointed Army chief General Manoj Pande received the Param Vishisht Seva Medal from President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday. The medal is awarded to all ranks of the Indian Armed Forces to recognise exceptional peace-time service. The gallantry awards ceremony was held at Rashtrapati Bhavan in Delhi today.

103.title: He was fearless: Danish Siddiqui's father as he wins 2nd Pulitzer
103.article_body: After slain photojournalist Danish Siddiqui won his second Pulitzer Prize, his father said he faced all kinds of pressures but he was fearless. Siddiqui was killed last year while covering a clash between Afghan security forces and Taliban forces. His father Mohammad Akhtar Siddiqui said he was a workaholic and was extremely professionally committed.

104.title: Prez Kovind condoles demise of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma
104.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday condoled the death of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma and said, "[His] recitals would leave connoisseurs of Indian classical music spellbound." President Kovind added, "Sad to learn that his Santoor is now silenced. Condolences to his family." Pandit Shivkumar Sharma passed away due to cardiac arrest at the age of 84 on Tuesday.

105.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest rowdy sheeter, recover 20 kg ganja
105.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday arrested a rowdy sheeter and recovered over 20 kilograms of ganja and a dagger knife from his possession. According to the police, the man had hidden the ganja in a plastic gunny bag, containing 10 wrap packs of ganja. He was involved in 34 criminal cases, including murder, robbery, kidnapping and extortion, police said.

106.title: Didn't attend a wedding in 8yrs of 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii': Sakshi
106.article_body: Actress Sakshi Tanwar has revealed in an interview that she didn't attend any weddings during the eight years of her television show 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii' because she wouldn't get the time. She further said that she's now in a phase where work is only a part of her life so she can be with her daughter and her family.

107.title: JD(U) leader urges Bihar CM to save his family from his wife, Naxal commander
107.article_body: JD(U) leader Awadesh Lal Dev has requested Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to save his and his family members' lives from a Naxal group active in Darbhanga. Awadesh claimed that his wife has links with Naxal commander Manoj Laldev, who is threatening to kill his entire family. "On April 23, Manoj along with 50-60 Naxals arrived at my house," he added.

108.title: I can't open my mouth in front of her: Manoj Pahwa on wife Seema
108.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that he can't open his mouth in front of his wife actress Seema Pahwa. He added that she is a senior actor and can make him feel grounded in a second. Manoj further said that his family is full of critics and Seema has criticised his "terrible acting", saying that he could've done better.

109.title: 2 use forged tickets to enter Pune Airport to see off classmate
109.article_body: Two college students were booked for entering the Pune International Airport using a forged screenshot of an air ticket to see off a classmate who was leaving for Jaipur. The BCom students were caught by the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) while leaving the airport, officers said. The youths are yet to be arrested, police said.

110.title: We outplayed MI in all 3 departments: Shreyas on KKR's 52-run win
110.article_body: Following KKR's 52-run win over MI in IPL, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said his side outplayed the five-time champions in all three departments. "Let's try to gauge what we did really well...let it get into your mind so that we can keep repeating this thing again and again," he added. Chasing 166, MI were all-out for 113 in 17.3 overs.

111.title: Ran out of money during lockdown, in theatre you earn ₹2,000: Sarika
111.article_body: Actress Sarika said that she ran out of money during the COVID-19 pandemic and added that she returned to acting as working in theatre during her acting break earned her ₹2,000-2,700. Talking about the break, Sarika said, "It was a very conscious decision... I thought it would be for a year but it turned out to be five years."

112.title: There's no cut footage of Cruise in 'Doctor Strange 2': Screenwriter
112.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' screenwriter Michael Waldron said Tom Cruise was considered to be part of the film, however, it never happened due to Cruise's availability. He stated Cruise was shooting for Mission Impossible 7 and 8. Adding that the fan theories were made up, he said, "I mean there's no cut footage of Tom Cruise!"

113.title: Johnny Depp is possessed by pirate demons: Pastor Bob Larson
113.article_body: Evangelist and self-proclaimed exorcist Pastor Bob Larson has claimed that actor Johnny Depp has been possessed by "pirate demons". He said, "I wonder, did Depp get actual pirate demons from playing his Jack Sparrow role [in 'Pirates of the Caribbean']?" This comes amid Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her op-ed claiming to be a domestic abuse survivor.

114.title: Bombay HC refuses to let teen rape victim abort 29-week pregnancy
114.article_body: Bombay HC has denied permission to a 16-year-old rape survivor to terminate her 29-week pregnancy and has directed the Maharashtra government to pay the survivor an interim compensation of ₹50,000. The HC refused permission as a team of doctors opined that if the pregnancy was terminated at this stage, the baby would be born prematurely and suffer from lifelong morbidities.

115.title: Pune civic body plans to charge vehicles for parking on major roads
115.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation is planning to implement a policy under which vehicles will be charged for parking on major city roads. The parking policy was approved by the standing committee in 2018 but did not have a political consensus, a civic official said. He added that PMC will finalise the strategy after discussing it with the police.

116.title: Rahul Dravid not to attend BJP event in Himachal Pradesh, says 'reports incorrect'
116.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has refuted media reports which claimed that he would be participating in BJP Yuva Morcha's National Working Committee session in Dharamshala. "A section of the media has reported that I will attend a meeting in Himachal Pradesh from May 12-15. I wish to clarify that the said report is incorrect," Dravid told ANI.

117.title: Assam tackling illegal migration strongly, Bengal isn't: Amit Shah
117.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised Assam for tackling illegal migration strongly while alleging that Bengal hadn't cooperated with the Centre on the same issue. Reacting to Shah's remarks, TMC called them "baseless", adding that it's Border Security Force's (BSF) duty to curb cross-border infiltration. Bengal government has extended all support to Centre on this issue, a TMC leader said.

118.title: Hyderabad Police stops child marriage, rescues minor girl
118.article_body: The She Team of Rachakonda Police averted a child marriage in the Chikatimamidi area and rescued a minor girl. The police also counselled the elders and briefed them about the demerits of child marriage. Last month, Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh M Bhagwat had said that parents, priests, wedding invitation printers, elders and supporters of child marriage will be held responsible.

119.title: Groom shoots guest after argument over music during wedding in UP
119.article_body: A guest at a wedding was shot dead by the groom following an argument over the playing of songs in UP's Muzaffarnagar, police said on Tuesday. Both the groom and the bride's side clashed during the wedding procession as some of them objected to the playing of songs by the DJ, Additional Superintendent of Police (rural) Atul Srivastava said.

120.title: How can PBKS, who have the 2nd worst NRR, still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
120.article_body: PBKS are currently placed eighth on IPL 2022 points table with 10 points. PBKS currently have the second-worst net run-rate (NRR) of -0.231. PBKS would need to win their remaining three matches (against RCB, DC and SRH) with huge margins to get to 16 points and better their NRR. They'd also want RR and RCB to lose their remaining matches.

121.title: IAS officer said 'strong winds' led to Bihar bridge collapse, I was amazed: Gadkari
121.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said he was "amazed" when his secretary, an IAS officer, told him that a portion of an under-construction bridge in Bihar had collapsed due to "strong winds". Gadkari added, "I fail to understand how a bridge collapsed due to strong winds." The minister also said, "There must be something wrong with the structure."

122.title: You have many questions: Debina on trolling for holding baby 'carelessly'
122.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee has responded to social media users who trolled her for holding her baby "carelessly" in a video she shared. The actress wrote on Instagram Stories, "So many questions you have!! Why I hold my baby a certain way...All I say is I am surrounded by...protective hands as you can see who say it's all fine."

123.title: Indonesian President plans to meet Musk over nickel supply
123.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo is planning to meet Tesla CEO Elon Musk during a US visit this week, the country's Coordinating Minister Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said. He added that Musk's representatives were currently in Indonesia and due to visit the nickel production hub of Morowali. Indonesia wants to enter the global supply chain of the EV industry, Luhut said previously.

124.title: German antitrust body's data curb order 'clearly flawed': Meta
124.article_body: Meta on Tuesday said German antitrust watchdog's order to curb Facebook's data collection is "clearly flawed". The order, passed in 2019, said Facebook had abused its market power by collecting users' data without their consent and ordered it to stop. Meta also criticised the German watchdog for not cooperating with the Irish data protection regulator which supervises Facebook.

125.title: I'll make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed: New BBMP chief
125.article_body: The new Chief Commissioner of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), Tushar Giri Nath, has said that he will make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed. He said that monsoon preparedness, preventing the spread of COVID-19 and enhancement of infrastructure are his top priorities. He added that BESCOM and BWSSB should work in coordination and respond to citizens' woes immediately.

126.title: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
126.article_body: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.

127.title: Ranveer's 'Jayeshbhai...' cleared for release, court orders new disclaimers to be added
127.article_body: Delhi High Court has cleared Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for theatrical release on May 13, asking the producers to add new disclaimers. It was hearing a petition that sought removal of a scene involving pre-natal sex determination test. Earlier, the court had demanded a screening, asking producers to show them the relevant scene or face a stay on the release.

128.title: 60 fishermen escape unhurt as their boats capsize off Odisha coast
128.article_body: A group of 60 fishermen had a narrow escape after their boats capsized off Odisha coast in Ganjam due to high tide in the wake of Cyclone Asani. All the fishermen managed to swim to the shore. In the wake of the cyclone, fishermen were advised not to venture into the sea along and off Odisha coast till May 13.

129.title: AAP govt harmful to Punjab's security: Congress' Jaiveer Shergill
129.article_body: Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill criticised the AAP government in Punjab, calling it "harmful" to the state's security a day after a rocket-propelled grenade hit Punjab Police's intelligence wing headquarters in Mohali. He requested Home Minister Amit Shah to get central agencies to probe the incident. "Attack on Police office in Mohali should serve as an alarm...for administration!" he tweeted.

130.title: Class 12 student in Andhra dies while waiting outside exam centre
130.article_body: A 17-year-old class 12 student, Satish, collapsed and died outside the examination centre in Andhra Pradesh's Guduru on Tuesday. A resident of Kammavaripalli village, Satish has been travelling to the town daily to appear in the annual examinations. He suddenly started sweating and collapsed on ground while waiting outside the centre. Doctors suspect he might have suffered cardiac arrest.

131.title: G7's concern over Hong Kong leader's selection is interference: China
131.article_body: China said on Tuesday that G7 countries' concern over the selection of Hong Kong's new chief executive was interference in China's internal affairs. This comes after G7 nations said that selection criteria for the post underscored worries about fundamental freedoms in Hong Kong. John Lee was elected as Hong Kong's new leader by a largely pro-Beijing committee on Sunday.

132.title: Kannada singer falls into open drain with 'chest-deep water' in B'luru, criticises BBMP
132.article_body: Kannada singer Ajay Warrier has claimed that he sustained several stitches and multiple bruises on his leg after he fell into an open drain in Bengaluru. "The water was up to my chest," he said. While criticising the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, Warrier added, "As a...tax-paying citizen of Bengaluru, I'm here to spread this message as a public safety warning."

133.title: Carlos Alcaraz is undoubtedly the best player in the world: Djokovic
133.article_body: Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has been undoubtedly the world's best player so far this year. "At Roland Garros, he is...one of the...favourites...though he's never reached the second week of a Grand Slam," added Djokovic. Alcaraz recently became the first player to beat both Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament, during the Madrid Open.

134.title: Ex-village head held for threatening Dalits from entering his field in UP
134.article_body: A former village head was arrested for allegedly threatening the members of the Dalit community from entering his field in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district. Furious after some Dalit members refused to work in his field, the accused, identified as Rajbir Tyagi, announced that Dalit members would be beaten with shoes 50 times if they tried to enter the field.

135.title: Lack of oxygen likely led to fish deaths at Banganga Tank: BMC
135.article_body: A probe by Mumbai's civic body BMC revealed that a severe oxygen deficiency in the city's historic Banganga Tank could have led to the death of thousands of fish. The report comes 20 days after several fish were found belly up in the tank. The water's colour had turned light green due to the presence of toxic components, it said.

136.title: SC asks Centre if sedition law can be put on hold till review, wants reply tomorrow
136.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Centre to reply by tomorrow on whether the sedition law can be paused while the law is being reviewed. "In order to protect the interest of people who are already booked as well as future cases, Centre to file response on whether those can be kept in abeyance till law is re-examined," the court said.

137.title: Jodie Comer to star in Benedict Cumberbatch-backed apocalyptic thriller
137.article_body: Jodie Comer, who recently won the Leading Actress award at the BAFTA TV Awards, has bagged an apocalyptic thriller, 'The End We Start From'. Mahalia Belo has been roped in to direct the film, while Benedict Cumberbatch is attached to the project as executive producer. It is an adaptation of the 2017 novel of the same name by Megan Hunter.

138.title: Anupam hosts 'Fauda' actor Tsahi Halevi at his acting institute, shares video
138.article_body: Anupam Kher hosted Israeli actor Tsahi Halevi, who starred in the spy series 'Fauda', at his acting institute 'Anupam Kher's Actor Prepares' in Mumbai. Taking to Twitter on Monday, Anupam shared a video in which Tsahi could be seen singing 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' at the diploma ceremony of the institute. "We loved the song! Thank you for...warm visit," Anupam wrote.

139.title: Govt aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030: Scindia
139.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government is aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Addressing the 'Experience Studio on Drones' event organised by NITI Aayog, Scindia said the drone industry has a huge potential and can lead to 10,000 jobs. He added India would need nearly a lakh drone pilots in the coming years.

140.title: Always listen to your wife: Pune Police chief to man planning to relocate
140.article_body: Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta replied to over 35 questions during a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a man from Mumbai asked him whether he should relocate to Bengaluru or Pune, which his wife prefers, Gupta replied, "Both are lovely cities, but the rule book says 'Always listen to your wife!'"

141.title: Manipur Police arrest Mumbai BPO employee for post on tribal chief
141.article_body: A 38-year-old resident of Mumbai's Mira Road, Pau Lian Kap, was arrested by Manipur Police after he posted about the death of tribal chief Raja Goukhothang Guite on social media. Kap was arrested after a complaint by the chairperson of the Raja Goukhothang Guite 150th Death Commemoration Committee, reports say. The complaint said that the post promoted enmity between communities.

142.title: Nitin Gadkari inaugurates pothole repair machine in Delhi
142.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Monday inaugurated a pothole repair machine developed by Central Road Research Institute (CRRI). The unique mobile cold mixer cum paver and patch-fill machine can repair 12-15 medium-sized potholes within one hour, officials said. The machines cost ₹30 lakh per unit compared to imported machines that cost ₹2 crore.

143.title: We need to revitalise world economy in inclusive ways: Raghuram Rajan
143.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that in order to raise investment and productivity, the need is to revitalise global growth in inclusive ways. In an article published in Financial Times, Rajan said, "The easiest solution economically, and the hardest politically, is to reverse the trend to deglobalisation." Developing countries' public spending has been constrained in the pandemic, he added.

144.title: Calling Marvel films 'lesser art' disrespectful to crew: Elizabeth
144.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, who portrays Scarlet Witch in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has stated that criticising Marvel films as a "lesser type of art" takes away from "the hundreds of very talented crew people". She further said diminishing them with that kind of criticism takes away from all the people who do award-winning films and also work on these projects.

145.title: BJP, Congress want to 'finish off' JD(S): Former K'taka CM Kumaraswamy
145.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday alleged that both BJP and the Congress are luring his party leaders from old Mysuru region. "Their main agenda is to finish off JD(S) and are competing for it," he said, adding that 'true' JD(S) supporters and workers will not abandon the party. "If this regional party remains...this state has future," Kumaraswamy added.

146.title: MP Navneet Rana harassed because she is a Dalit: Ramdas Athawale
146.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has alleged that MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana are facing injustice because of her being a Dalit. "I have always supported Navneet because a great injustice has been done to her by the Maharashtra government," Athawale said. "Sedition should not be imposed in the name of reading Hanuman Chalisa," he added.

147.title: PM Modi replicating Gujarat model across India: Rahul Gandhi
147.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of replicating Gujarat model across India and said, "As the Prime Minister, Modi is doing in country what he did as the chief minister in Gujarat - creating one India for rich and another for common people." Resources of the country are being given away to...few wealthy people, he added.

148.title: 20 died within 6 days of onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022: U'khand govt
148.article_body: As many as 20 people have died within six days of the onset of Char Dham Yatra, the Uttarakhand Health Department confirmed. Most of these deaths have occurred due to cardiac-related issues and altitude sickness, it said. While 14 passengers died in Yamunotri and Gangotri Dham, five devotees died in Kedarnath and one in Badrinath Dham, as per government record.

149.title: Delhi's Mathura Road to be traffic signal-free, to get 4 U-turn underpasses
149.article_body: In a bid to end traffic jams and make travel between central and south Delhi easier, Delhi's Mathura Road stretch will be made traffic signal-free. Public Works Department will remove all five traffic signals on the stretch. Meanwhile, four U-turn underpasses will be provided for smooth travel. Officials said this will be part of ongoing Pragati Maidan corridor redevelopment project.

150.title: Russia's Rutube remains offline for 2nd day, says, 'Hit with biggest cyberattack'
150.article_body: Russia's video platform Rutube remained offline for a second consecutive day on Tuesday after it was hit by a cyberattack just before it was about to stream the Victory Day parade in Moscow on Monday. "We have, in fact, been hit with the biggest cyberattack in Rutube's history," the platform said in a message on Telegram on Tuesday.

151.title: Permission required to use loudspeakers over next 15 days: Karnataka govt
151.article_body: Following Karnataka CM BS Bommai's meeting with state Home Department officials, the state government announced that permission would be required to use loudspeakers in the state over the next 15 days. According to the state government, those who haven't obtained permission should voluntarily remove the loudspeakers. A committee would be formed to decide on the application for use of loudspeakers.

152.title: When I was small, I would always keep the light on: Rafael Nadal
152.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he would always keep the light on when he was small, adding that he nowadays falls asleep with the television on. "Being alone in the dark is something I don't like. I'm not the most courageous guy in the world outside...the court," Nadal had earlier stated. "I won't go on the motorbike," he had further said.

153.title: Tiger Global hit by $17 bn losses in tech stock sell-off: Report
153.article_body: Tiger Global has faced losses of around $17 billion during this year's technology stock sell-off, the Financial Times reported. The firm has erased around two-thirds of its gains in four months, the report added citing calculations by LCH Investments. The losses are reportedly higher than some of the $4-trillion hedge fund industry's most recent losses.

154.title: Group pelts stones at vehicles on highway in MP; several injured
154.article_body: Several people were injured after a group of unknown people pelted stones at vehicles on a four-lane highway on the outskirts of Madhya Pradesh's Badnawar town, police said on Tuesday. The group did so with the intention of theft, however, the occupants didn't stop their vehicles, Free Press Journal reported. The police arrested two people while the others ran away.

155.title: Indian in Dubai stalks, sends lewd messages to Gurugram woman, held
155.article_body: A 30-year-old UP resident working as a domestic servant in Dubai was arrested for stalking a Gurugram woman and sending her sexually suggestive messages, police said on Monday. "The accused claims he doesn't know the woman and he started sending her obscene messages and videos after she replied to her initial messages," said Arti, SHO Women Police Station, Manesar.

156.title: Mentally challenged man hangs himself after killing wife in Tripura
156.article_body: A mentally challenged man hanged himself after killing his wife in a remote village in Tripura. According to police, the incident occurred on Monday when Somen Nath was having lunch with his father-in-law while his wife was serving the food. Somen then allegedly hit his wife with an iron rod after his father-in-law went in to wash hands, police said.

157.title: Actor-model Jethro Lazenby, son of Australian singer Nick Cave, dies at 31
157.article_body: Australian actor-model Jethro Lazenby has passed away at the age of 31. The news of his demise was shared by his father, singer-songwriter Nick Cave. "We'd be grateful for family privacy at this time," he said in a statement. In 2015, Nick's son Arthur died in an accidental fall from a cliff near Brighton, England, at the age of 15.

158.title: 28.5% adults in India are hypertensive: Nationwide survey
158.article_body: In India, 28.5% of adults are hypertensive, according to a multi-centric national survey conducted by the ICMR - National Centre for Disease Informatics and Research. Among them, 27.9% were aware of their hypertensive status, 14.5% were under treatment and 12.6% had their blood pressure under control, according to the survey.

159.title: Man covers bike's number plate with face mask in Hyderabad; fined
159.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday fined a motorist for covering his bike's number plate with a face mask at Rasoolpura, according to a report. The motorist has also been fined for breaking the bike's front number plate. Sharing the information about this incident on Twitter, Hyderabad City Police warned citizens and said, "You could be the next...Correct your improper plates."

160.title: Sri Lankan Prez extends nationwide curfew till May 11 amid unrest
160.article_body: Amid the unrest over economic crisis, Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Tuesday extended the nationwide curfew till May 11. "I instruct everybody not to use any public roads, railways, public parks, public recreation areas or other public territories or the seashore from 7 pm (local time) on May 9 to 7 am on May 11," a presidential decree said.

161.title: Shimron Hetmyer blessed with first child, RR share video
161.article_body: RR batter Shimron Hetmyer has been blessed with his first child. RR took to Instagram to share a video of Hetmyer holding the newborn in his arms and wrote, "The newest (and the cutest) addition to our #RoyalsFamily. Congratulations, @shetmyer and @tequila_goddess_nu." Hetmyer had gone to Guyana for his child's birth and is expected to join RR squad later.

162.title: We aim to end maths phobia: 22-yr-old 'fastest human calculator' on his startup
162.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old Indian called the 'world's fastest human calculator' for his mental calculation, founded maths edtech startup Bhanzu in 2020. "We aim to eradicate maths phobia and encourage careers in maths and STEM fields," he said. Bhanzu, which provides experiential maths learning courses online, raised its $2 million seed round led by ﻿Lightspeed in February 2022.

163.title: SBI hikes interest rates on bulk term deposits from today
163.article_body: SBI has increased interest rates on its bulk term deposits of ₹2 crore and above across all its tenors except for the 7-45 days tenor. Effective from May 10, for the 46-179 days tenor, the rate has been increased to 3.50% from 3% and for 180-210 days tenor, the rate has been hiked to 3.50% from 3.10%.

164.title: Helen to make acting comeback after 10 years with Karisma-starrer 'Brown...'
164.article_body: Actress Helen will make her comeback to acting after nearly 10 years, with a drama series titled 'Brown - The First Case' starring Karisma Kapoor. It will be directed by Abhinay Deo who helmed the film 'Delhi Belly'. Helen was last seen in 2012 film 'Heroine' which featured Kareena Kapoor Khan. "I was nervous...[about] how things have changed," said Helen.

165.title: I'm glad I chose such a strong project for my OTT debut: Kangana on Lock Upp
165.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, who hosted the recently concluded reality show 'Lock Upp', has called the show an "absolute game-changer in the OTT reality space". She added she's glad that she chose "such a strong and impactful project" for her OTT debut. "The country loved a bold yet original concept...and I'd an incredible time playing...host in this badass jail," said Kangana.

166.title: There's no fear of world in their game: Gavaskar on IPL debutants GT
166.article_body: Commenting on Gujarat Titans' form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the IPL debutants are performing well and winning because "there's no fear of the world in their game". He added, "They are enjoying their game and playing positive cricket." GT are currently placed second on the points table, having won eight out of 11 matches so far.

167.title: Nordic defence will get boost if Finland, Sweden join NATO: Minister
167.article_body: Nordic region's defence capabilities will receive a boost if Finland and Sweden decide to join NATO, Swedish Defence Minister Peter Hultqvist said on Tuesday. The countries' joint membership would allow mutual defence planning within NATO's framework, he added. Hultqvist's comments come after Sweden's ruling party said that it'll announce its stance on the country's potential membership on May 15.

168.title: New York Times drops 'fetus' as Wordle solution amid abortion rights row in US
168.article_body: The New York Times, which owns 'Wordle', on Monday removed the word "fetus" as the game's solution to keep it "distinct from the news". This comes amid a row over the leaked Supreme Court draft opinion which indicated that abortion rights may be restricted in the US. The paper warned that some users may still see the outdated answer.

169.title: New Indian VPN regulations are an assault on privacy: ProtonVPN
169.article_body: VPN service ProtonVPN, operated by a Swiss company, called India's new VPN regulations "an assault on privacy", adding that they "threaten to put citizens under a microscope of surveillance". "We remain committed to our no-logs policy," it added. The new VPN regulations released by CERT-In require VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer.

170.title: Jharkhand Mining Secretary appears before ED in money laundering case
170.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal on Tuesday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds, officials said. The ED is expected to record Singhal's statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. It had briefly questioned her during raids that were conducted against her on May 6.

171.title: 'Holy man' whose followers ate his faeces arrested in Thailand; police find 11 dead bodies
171.article_body: Police in northeastern Thailand have arrested a self-proclaimed holy man whose followers ate his faeces and drank his urine as a cure for sickness, officials said on Monday. Officers raided the thatched house of 75-year-old Thawee Nanra on Sunday deep in a jungle in Chaiyaphum province. Police said they found 11 corpses on the premises.

172.title: Bumrah showed us the tough length to bowl on DY Patil pitch: KKR's Cummins
172.article_body: Crediting Jasprit Bumrah for his bowling against KKR in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Pat Cummins(3/22) said the MI pacer showed them the tough length to bowl on DY Patil Stadium pitch on Monday. Bumrah's first five-wicket haul in IPL helped reduce KKR from 136/3 in the 14th over to 165/9 after 20. KKR beat MI by 52 runs.

173.title: Issues like Ayodhya visit taking priority instead of inflation: Pawar
173.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that while issues like Ayodhya visit and reciting prayers are taking priority, the Centre has “failed” in tackling the problems of inflation and unemployment. His statement comes ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5. Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will also be visiting Ayodhya on June 10.

174.title: 27-yr-old woman kills self over husband's house not having toilet
174.article_body: A 27-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide following arguments with her husband over his house not having a toilet in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore. The couple reportedly had been in a relationship for two years and got married in April.
