Railway Protection Force (RPF) and Bomb Detection and Disposal Squads (BDDS) teams are investigating it, a railway official said. Detonators contained explosive content as good as a cracker, Nagpur Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said.

349.title: Punjab on high alert after blast at Police Intelligence office in Mohali
349.article_body: Punjab was put on high alert on Monday night after a bomb blast took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. The Punjab Police had termed the explosion "minor" and said that probe into the matter was underway. Meanwhile, pictures from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes.

350.title: Train derails near Vienna in Austria; 1 killed, several injured
350.article_body: At least one person was killed and several others were injured when a train derailed near Austria's Vienna on Monday, said the Red Cross. The incident occurred at around 6 pm local time, after which a team of rescue workers and four emergency helicopters were deployed to the scene. Two of the carriages were seen lying overturned on the ground.

351.title: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
351.article_body: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.

352.title: Drunk man urinates in front of neighbour's house in Delhi, killed in fight
352.article_body: A 44-year-old property dealer, Parveen Lamba, was killed in Delhi after he got into fight with his neighbour, Rahul Malhotra, after urinating in front of Rahul's house in drunk state in Delhi. Both parties threw stones at each other during fight. Malhotra and his father threw bottles at Lamba, one of which, hurt his leg and he started bleeding profusely.

353.title: US announces free internet plan for crores of low-income citizens
353.article_body: The US government has announced a programme under which free internet will be provided to crores of low-income citizens. President Joe Biden's administration said that 20 internet companies have agreed to provide discounted $30 monthly plans for 100 Mbps to 4.8 crore households. Combined with the government's $30 monthly internet subsidy, the service will be free for crores of people.

354.title: 6 people arrested with petrol bombs, lethal weapons in Bengaluru
354.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested six people belonging to two different gangs and seized petrol bombs, a country pistol and sharp-edged weapons from them. According to police, the gangs were planning to attack each other and create social unrest in the city. The accused had purchased 19 beer bottles and filled 10 bottles with petrol, DCP (East) Bheemashankar Guled said.

355.title: 38-year-old man beaten to death in road rage incident in Pune
355.article_body: A 38-year-old man was beaten to death by three persons on Lavasa Road in Pune in a road rage case, police said. The incident took place near Andgaon village on Sunday after one of the accused did not allow the victim and his cousin to pass. The deceased was on his way to meet his wife and children, police added.

356.title: Scaler’s Data Science program opens doors for non-coders
356.article_body: Scaler shares that its Data Science & Analytics program is here to equip users with data-driven business decision-making skills, regardless of coding experience. Experienced users can dive deeper into coding with the Machine Learning program to solve business problems at scale. It added that their Masterclass could be the entry point in someone's Data Science career.

357.title: CEO is also involved in team selections: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer on frequent changes
357.article_body: During the presentation ceremony after their victory against MI, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer revealed that the franchise CEO Venky Mysore is also involved in team selections. Iyer was answering a question on frequent changes to their playing XI. Iyer added that it is really difficult to tell players about axings. "Each and every player takes it well," he added.

358.title: Indian Railways introduces foldable 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail, pics surface
358.article_body: Indian Railways' Northern Railway has introduced 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail on Mother's Day. The Northern Railway Lucknow Division tweeted, "A baby berth has been introduced in Coach no 194129/ B4, berth no 12 & 60 in Lucknow Mail, to facilitate mothers travelling with their baby. Fitted baby seat is foldable about hinge and is secured with a stopper."

359.title: Played special music as Akshay walked from vanity to sets: Prithviraj director
359.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi said that the team had recorded a special music track for actor Akshay Kumar. "We used to play that music for him when he would walk from his vanity van to the sets of Prithviraj. This was done so that he would leave behind present era and travel to the era of Prithviraj," he added.

360.title: Dangerous: Cyberabad Traffic Police on video of red light accident
360.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of an accident caused due to vehicles jumping a red light and said that doing so "always" puts a person in "danger". The video shows a truck colliding with two vehicles that purportedly jumped the red light at a crossing. The traffic police also used the hashtags "#RoadSafetyCyberabad and #RoadSafety".

361.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as MI record their most losses in a season?
361.article_body: MI registered their most defeats in an IPL season after losing their ninth match in IPL 2022, against KKR on Monday. MI are last on the table with four points and a net run-rate of -0.894. KKR jumped to the seventh position with 10 points. DC, SRH and PBKS are the other teams having 10 points each.

362.title: Kieron Pollard accidentally hits umpire with the ball while bowling, video goes viral
362.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard accidentally hit on-field umpire Chris Gaffaney with the ball while bowling during his team's match against KKR. While Pollard was about to bowl the fifth delivery in KKR's 10th over, the ball slipped out of his hands and hit the umpire. "When you're throwing chalk at your friend, but it hits the teacher," a user tweeted.

363.title: Journalist Danish who was killed in Afghanistan wins Pulitzer for covering COVID in India
363.article_body: Indian photojournalist Danish Siddiqui who was killed while covering the war in Afghanistan last year has been posthumously awarded a Pulitzer Prize along with Adnan Abidi, Sanna Irshad Mattoo, and Amit Dave for coverage of COVID-19 in India. In 2018, Siddiqui was awarded a Pulitzer Prize for coverage of the Rohingya crisis.

364.title: FIR against AAP MLA for 'obstructing' Shaheen Bagh demolition drive
364.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday filed an FIR against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Amanatullah Khan for allegedly obstructing the anti-encroachment drive at Shaheen Bagh following a complaint by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation. "Khan and his supporters interfered in government duty at Shaheen Bagh," the police said. Protests erupted at Shaheen Bagh on Monday against the anti-encroachment drive.

365.title: Govt calls meeting with Uber, Ola amid rising consumer complaints
365.article_body: The Centre has called a meeting with cab aggregators Ola and Uber on Tuesday to discuss their policies after it received various complaints from consumers about their unfair trade practices, ride cancellation policy and surge pricing, among others. It will also seek information from them on how they calculate fares, cancellation charges and measures for consumer data protection.

366.title: Daddy showing who is the boss: Ravi Shastri on Bumrah's first-ever 5-wicket haul in IPL
366.article_body: After Jasprit Bumrah recorded his first-ever five-wicket haul in IPL, former India head coach Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Daddy showing who is the boss." He added, "Hope the young boys are watching. Class is permanent." Bumrah registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR, the best figures by any bowler in IPL 2022.

367.title: Apna chashma badal: Suniel Shetty to Twitter user who wrongly tagged him for tobacco ad
367.article_body: Suniel Shetty responded to a Twitter user who wrongly called him out over advertising tobacco. Tagging various actors, the person wrote, "Your kids have to feel shame on you to lead nation in wrong way." Suniel replied, "Bhai tu apna chashma adjust kar le ya badal de (Brother, adjust your glasses or change them)." The person later apologised to him.

368.title: Experience a new era of cooling with Carrier air conditioners: Carrier
368.article_body: Carrier announced that as the inventor of modern air conditioning, it has kept in sync with evolving consumer demands for energy-efficient room air conditioners with advanced features. The 2022 range of air conditioners includes personalized cooling on a single click with Flexicool 6-in-1, faster cooling with Insta Cool and easy access to features with Carrier Smart Connect, the company stated.

369.title: Amit Shah launches sale of Khadi products in 107 CAPF canteens
369.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday launched the sale of khadi products in 107 Central Armed Police Force (CAPF) canteens. Shah, who's on a three-day tour of Assam, said khadi products will be made available in all paramilitary canteens across India soon. He had earlier made it mandatory for CAPF canteens to sell maximum "Swadeshi" products through Khadi and KVIC.

370.title: MP man fakes death after stealing ₹6.7 lakh, arrested after 9 months
370.article_body: A 34-year-old man, who allegedly faked his death to evade arrest in a theft case in MP's Chhatarpur district, has been caught after nine months. Sunil Namdeo had gone missing after collecting ₹6.65 lakh cash on behalf of a trader in July last year, police said. An unidentified body was later found which Namdeo's family identified as his.

371.title: Raj Police seize 1,300 kg silver & ₹56 lakh cash from bus, probe on
371.article_body: Police in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district on Sunday seized 1,321 kg of silver among other jewellery items along with ₹56 lakh in cash from a private bus while acting on a tip-off. The bus was going from Agra to Ahmedabad and the consignment had to be delivered at different places, police said, adding that the driver was unable to produce documents.

372.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres
372.article_body: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres in a case filed by multi-business chemicals firm SRF. As per SRF, Birla Tyres defaulted on payment of ₹15.84 crore for the supply of tyre cord fabric as of July 8, 2021. NCLT reprimanded Birla Tyres for taking a "casual attempt" to seek adjournments.

373.title: KKR keep their IPL 2022 playoffs hopes alive with 52-run victory against MI
373.article_body: KKR defeated MI by 52 runs in IPL 2022 on Monday to stay in the contention for a playoffs berth. With the win, KKR moved to the seventh spot from ninth spot on the points table. MI have now lost nine matches in the tournament. KKR will next face SRH on Saturday, while MI will next face CSK on Thursday.

374.title: Blast at Punjab Police Intelligence office in Mohali, pics showing damage surface
374.article_body: A blast was reported at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali late on Monday, officials said. Pictures released from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes. In a statement, the Punjab Police termed the explosion "minor", adding, "Senior officers are on the spot and an investigation is being done." A rocket-propelled grenade reportedly caused the blast.

375.title: Once a king, always a king: Harbhajan to Bumrah on his 5/10 vs KKR
375.article_body: Following MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul against KKR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Once a king, always a king. What a phenomenal spell by Bumrah." S Badrinath took to Twitter and wrote, "Form is temporary, class is permanent. Boom boom performance." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 4-1-10-5 to help restrict KKR to 165/9 in 20 overs.

376.title: Delhi sees less than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.94%
376.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 799 new cases of COVID-19 and three deaths. The positivity rate in the city was reported at 4.94% as compared to 5.34% reported on Sunday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours dropped to 5,369 from 5,939 on Sunday. Delhi recorded 1,422 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday and 1,407 cases on Saturday.

377.title: Pak politician's 3rd wife aged 18 files for divorce 4 months after marriage
377.article_body: Pakistani politician Aamir Liaquat's third wife Syeda Dania Shah said she has filed for divorce from the 49-year-old, calling him 'worse than devil', the local media reported. Shah, who is 18 years old, married Liaquat in February 2022. She has alleged that Liaquat beat her after getting intoxicated, while Liaquat denied the accusations.

378.title: He's gone better and better: Hesson on Hasaranga after his 5/18 vs SRH
378.article_body: Praising Wanindu Hasaranga following his 5/18 in RCB's 67-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the spinner has gone better and better as the tournament has progressed. "He...sort of packs a punch, he usually gets himself a lot of ground...generates a lot of power and a lot of leverage," he added.

379.title: Parts of Mumbai face power outages due to technical fault at Tata Power station
379.article_body: Power outages were reported in parts of Mumbai, including Bandra, Khar and Dharavi, after a transmission line tripped on Monday. The electricity supply was snapped due to a technical fault at Tata Power's receiving station located in Dharavi, as per information reportedly received from the Maharashtra Energy Department. The latest outages were reportedly faced by consumers of Adani Electricity.

380.title: I saw the Taj Mahal in 2007, it's truly a wonder of the world: Elon Musk
380.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "It's amazing. I visited in 2007 and also saw the Taj Mahal, which truly is a wonder of the world." Musk was responding to a tweet that claimed to show a facade from a fort in Agra. Several Indian Twitter users responded to Musk's tweet, asking, "Any plans to visit India soon?"

381.title: French court reduces sentence of ex-PM Fillon in embezzlement case
381.article_body: A French appeals court on Monday cut a year off the five-year jail term given to former Prime Minister François Fillon for embezzling public funds. Upholding Fillon's conviction, the court changed the sentence to four years in jail, three of them suspended. Notably, Fillon's jail term was not enforced while his appeal was pending.

382.title: Rohit's shocked reaction after his controversial DRS dismissal goes viral, fans react
382.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma was declared out by third umpire after KKR opted for DRS for a caught behind. A video of Rohit's shocked reaction went viral on social media as the UltraEdge showed a spike even before the ball passed the bat. "IPL should also include HotSpot," a fan tweeted. "Very very poor umpiring this season," another wrote.

383.title: Russian missiles hit Odessa during European Council Prez's visit
383.article_body: European Council President Charles Michel on Monday made a surprise visit to Odessa, during which he was forced to take cover as Russian missiles hit the Ukrainian port city. Describing his visit, Michel tweeted, "I saw silos full of grain, wheat and corn ready for export." "This badly needed food is stranded because of the Russian war," he added.

384.title: Terrorist hideout busted in J&K's Poonch, ammunition found
384.article_body: J&K Police along with other security forces have busted a terrorist hideout in the Poonch district, officials said.  The hideout was found by the forces while carrying out a joint search operation in the forest area of Dera Ki Gali on Monday following information about suspicious movement in the area.  Around 100 assorted rounds of ammunition were recovered, officials added.

385.title: 18-year-old attacked with sticks & iron rods in Haryana, probe on
385.article_body: A class 12 student was allegedly attacked by a group of around 14 persons with sticks and iron rods while he was at his father's shop in Haryana's Hisar. The 18-year-old victim is currently undergoing treatment for his injuries. An FIR has been registered, police said, adding that the exact reason behind the incident is yet to be ascertained.

386.title: I think Bollywood can't afford me, I don't want to waste my time: Mahesh Babu
386.article_body: Telugu cinema star Mahesh Babu on Monday said, "I always wanted to do Telugu films and wished people across India would watch it. And now when that is happening, I'm very happy." He added, "I may sound arrogant...I did get a lot of offers in Hindi. But I think they can't afford me. I don't want to waste my time."

387.title: Somaiya family NGO got donations from firms on ED, CBI radar: Raut
387.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's Yuvak Pratishthan, an NGO run by his family, received donations worth crores from companies that were on ED, CBI, Income Tax department and SEBI's radar. "Is it a dirty game of turning black money to white?" Raut said. I will soon file complaint with investigative agencies, he added.

388.title: 98,000 quintals soybean worth ₹69 crore seized from MP factory
388.article_body: A joint investigation team of revenue and food departments seized 97,860 quintals of soybean worth over ₹69 crore from AV Agro Business Limited's factory in MP after conducting a surprise check. The action was taken as the company reportedly stocked soybean two-and-a-half times more than the prescribed limit. The seized stock was confiscated under provisions of the Essential Commodities Act.

389.title: 3 children drown while taking bath in Chambal river in MP's Morena
389.article_body: Three brothers, aged six, eight and 10, drowned while taking bath in the Chambal river in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district on Monday. The police were alerted by the family when the children failed to return for a long time following which a rescue operation was started. Their bodies were recovered later with the help of divers and locals.

390.title: Pope has postponed visit to Lebanon for health reasons: Minister
390.article_body: Pope Francis has postponed a planned visit to Lebanon that was scheduled for next month amid health concerns, Lebanese Minister Walid Nassar confirmed on Monday. Nassar added that a new date for the visit will be announced "as soon as it is determined". Pope Francis was recently spotted using a wheelchair in public owing to knee pain.

391.title: India beat Canada 5-0 to qualify for knockouts at 2022 Thomas Cup
391.article_body: India reached the knockout stage of 2022 Thomas Cup Finals after a 5-0 win against Canada in their Group C match in Bangkok on Monday. Notably, this is India's second successive win in the group. Ex-world number one Kidambi Srikanth gave India 1-0 lead followed by two doubles and two singles match wins. India will face Chinese Taipei on Wednesday.

392.title: Moderate to heavy rain, gusty winds likely in Bihar in next 2-3 days
392.article_body: Bihar is likely to witness moderate to heavy rain and gusty winds in the next two to three days as Cyclone Asani is intensifying in Odisha and Bengal, the Meteorological Centre said. North and south districts of Bihar may see heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms. Parts of the state recorded light to moderate rain in the last 24 hours.

393.title: Pakistan imposes ban on export of sugar amid domestic demand
393.article_body: Pakistan has imposed a complete ban on the export of sugar owing to domestic demand for the commodity, PM Shehbaz Sharif said on Monday. "There will be...strict action against smuggling and hoarding [of sugar]. Absolutely zero tolerance [will be shown] for those found negligent in their duties," Sharif tweeted. Consumers in Pakistan's Punjab have reportedly complained of shortage of sugar.

394.title: LIC IPO shares to be allocated on May 12, listing on May 17
394.article_body: Bidders in LIC IPO will be allocated shares on May 12, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has said. He added that LIC will be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, received 47.83 crore bids against 16.2 crore shares on offer.

395.title: Ancestral home of Lankan Prez Rajapaksa's family set on fire, video surfaces
395.article_body: The ancestral home of ex-Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was set ablaze on Monday by anti-government protesters amid an economic crisis. Videos and pictures of the vandalised property in Hambantota were also shared online. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as PM today amid violent clashes and protests across the country.

396.title: 11 fishermen stranded in Odisha sea airlifted to safety following CM's order
396.article_body: Eleven fishermen, who were stranded in the Sonepur sea in Odisha's Ganjam district on Monday, were successfully airlifted and taken to their native places safely, following CM Naveen Patnaik's prompt direction. The fishermen were stranded in the sea when they ventured into the waters for fishing activities. The boat ferrying them had faced some technical glitches, as per reports.

397.title: Strict action against those found guilty of Bihar PSC paper leak: CM
397.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said that strict action will be taken against those found guilty of the Bihar Public Service Commission question paper leak. "The question paper leak of the BPSC examination is a matter of serious concern. I have asked senior officials to complete the probe at the earliest," said Kumar.

398.title: Manage economy, not media headlines: Rahul to PM as rupee plummets
398.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked PM Narendra Modi to focus on managing the economy not media headlines as the rupee slumped to an all-time low against the US dollar. PM Modi criticised former PM Manmohan Singh whenever the rupee fell, Rahul tweeted. The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday.

399.title: Mexico to hire 500 doctors from Cuba amid a shortage: Prez Obrador
399.article_body: During a visit to Cuba, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday said that Mexico will hire 500 Cuban doctors as part of an effort to help make up for a shortage of medical professionals. Obrador met Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel and ex-President Raul Castro during the visit. Mexico will also purchase COVID-19 vaccines from Cuba, he added.

400.title: Imported EV cells may not be suitable for Indian conditions: NITI Aayog member
400.article_body: Battery cells imported for electric vehicles (EVs) may not be suitable for Indian conditions, NITI Aayog Member VK Saraswat said after multiple incidents of EVs catching fire were reported from across the country. "We should make sure that whatever cells we manufacture are suitable for Indian conditions of high temperature," Saraswat said. We must rigorously test imported cells, he added.

401.title: Next census to be e-census, will shape policies of next 25 yrs: Shah
401.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the next population census that will take place in the country will be an e-census "which will shape policies of the next 25 years". Shah further said that the names of citizens will be added to the electoral roll once they turn 18 and will be automatically deleted if someone dies.
